WRITING.TITLE: Redditors with a vague or obscure job title, how do you quickly explain to people what you do for a living?

WRITING.TEXT: Always research contact details of your consulate in that country, before you leave. Also, make a photocopy of your passport and keep it somewhere separate.
"Assassin's Apprentice" by Robin Hobb. It's fantasy. It's the first in a trilogy.

Some times it takes a while to figure out. Check out r/actuallesbians if you want to talk more about it.
Edit: ok so I had been drinking and thought this was in askreddit lol. My bad.
Meditation and stretching. Even if it's only a few mins when you get up/go to bed.

Get something that you enjoy seeing everyday. Don't get something that's on trend now, but will be out of style in a few months. If you can get some hands on some older home decor magazines, see what is still in style now. Know your budget. Maybe buy or invest in some art that you really enjoy. Commission something if you can afford it. Shop around, use pininterst boards.
I make websites and apps harder to navigate so they become unusable and annoying and you give up or delete the app.
The cat in the game looks exactly like our cat!

Where is the best place to stay? We will probably want to walk around, unless we should get a car? We love coffee, museums, history stuff, and maybe some dancing for my partner. I grew up in island bay. That's all I know lol

This game was recommended to me by a bunch of people from reddit for my partner who has PTSD. Honestly, it has changed my partners life. Playing games again is exciting and and it's amazing not having to worry about guns, cars running over people, seeing terrible gore. Thanks you so much u/concernedape

Thank you for your reply. I've never framed a coin before. Do you know if coin shops would do this? I don't think I'm game enough to cut the loop myself. I guess I could find a jeweler who would? I think the loop is made out of gold too.
So you reckon I shouldn't try it? Just keep it the way it is?

Yesterday my mum came over and gave me some things that I inherited from my grandmother who died in 1994. I was too young back then. This coin was one of the things. From my research, it's a 1861 Gold Sovereign : Victoria (Young Head) Shield. I don't want to sell it, I'd like to frame it if I can. But it has this loop on it, which I assume my grandmother wore around her neck. Any ideas on how (or even if) I can remove it?
Here's the other side: https://imgur.com/gallery/GZMmH

WRITING.TITLE: How do I remove this loop attached to this coin without damaging the coin?

WRITING.TEXT: I need that shirt!
So awesome that you posted because my girlfriend and I want to come visit Wellington. I'm from there but moved when I was 12, so I don't really know any scene except the area I grew up in.
Perth isn't that bad. I lived down in Busselton for a year....makes Perths scene seem raging! But seriously, come and visit Sydney. Mardi Gras is coming up!
Nice, will add it in.
Yep I was going to add in comments next to it. There are some things that are lgbti friendly rather than aiming towards lesbians.

WRITING.TITLE: Hey, I'm visiting [Insert City]. Where are all the lesbians?!
WRITING.TEXT:
There have been a few posts I've seen about "Hey I'm visiting/moving to [insert city]. Where are all the lesbians at!"
I thought we could make a thread, and write a bit about your city, so that there's a thread on lots of different cities. You can always come back and keep it updated.
Heres mine for Sydney. This is by no means a complete list, so feel free to add more to this.
**LGBTI Friendly status:** Very friendly
**LGBTI friendly areas to stay:**
[Newtown](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newtown,_New_South_Wales)
[Marrickville](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marrickville,_New_South_Wales)
[Erskineville](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erskineville,_New_South_Wales)
[St Peters](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/St_Peters,_New_South_Wales)
[Enmore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enmore,_New_South_Wales)
(These are all in the [inner west](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inner_West) which is generally known for its LGBTI-ness)
**Lesbian nightlife:**
[Girlthing](https://m.facebook.com/GiRLTHINGPARTY/) - Bar/Dancing
[Birdcage](https://m.facebook.com/birdcageparty/) -Bar/Dancing
[Lemons](http://www.sglba.org.au/?page=Lemons) - Bar/Networking
[Chick](https://m.facebook.com/chicksydney/) - Bar/Dancing
[Heaps Gay](http://heapsgay.com/category/party/) - Bar/Dancing
[Oxford St](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oxford_Street,_Sydney) - Mainly gay men bars/clubs but still fun.
[Hellfire](http://www.themidnightshift.com.au/event/hellfire/) - Not specifically lesbian, but its a BDSM club.
[Chicks with Picks](https://m.facebook.com/cwpsydney/) - Chill place on Sunday afternoons with female musicians.
**Teams you can join:**
[The Flying Bats](http://www.theflyingbats.com) (football/soccer)
[Bentstix](http://www.bentstix.com.au) (hockey)
[Sydney Frontrunners](http://www.sydneyfrontrunners.org/home/)
[Sydney Gaymers](https://m.facebook.com/SydneyGaymers/)
[Sydney Roller Derby](http://www.sydneyrollerderby.com)
[Sydney Outfielders](http://www.sydneyoutfielders.org.au) (softball)
**Reading Material:**
[LOTL](http://www.lotl.com)
[The Star Observer](http://www.starobserver.com.au)
[SameSame](http://m.samesame.com.au)
[Newtown Womens Library](http://thewomenslibrary.org.au)
[Sappho Books](http://www.sapphobooks.com.au)
**Support:**
[ACON](http://www.acon.org.au)
[Twenty10](http://www.twenty10.org.au)
[Pride In Diversity](http://www.prideindiversity.com.au)
**Other:**
[Queerstories](http://giantdwarf.com.au/events/queerstories/)
[Queer Screen](http://queerscreen.org.au)
[Mardi Gras Fair day](http://www.mardigras.org.au/fairday/) (Feb 19th)
[Mardi Gras Parade](http://www.mardigras.org.au) (March 4th)
[Gay and Lesbian Choir](https://www.sglc.org/home_201601008.html)
[LGBTI Church](http://www.mccsydney.org)
[Crave MCC](http://www.cravemcc.com/)
[Coogee Womens Baths](http://www.randwick.nsw.gov.au/facilities-and-recreation/beaches-and-coast/ocean-pools/mcivers-baths)
[Sydney Subreddit](http://reddit.com/r/sydney)
[Gay 4 Play](http://www.gay4play.com.au/) - Lots of different activities to do with other LGBTI people if you want to make friends. E.g going to movies, rock climbing, dinners etc.
Sydney lesbian here. Let me know if you need help with meeting other lesbians or just generally getting to know the city.

Thanks for posting this! I really want to do this. I keep putting off doing anything and I feel my physical (and mental) health declining everyday. I guess the best time for start this was yesterday, but the next best time is right now.

One of my New Years resolutions was to read 12 books in 12 months. I enjoy reading, it's more about the time doing it. No idea what books to start with. I really enjoy motivational books, fantasy novels (I've read a lot of robin hobb) and anything to do with my career (user experience/user interface design). Any recommendations?
